title: 5.3 is almost here and none of the promised champ changes are on the pbe
body:
Katrina changes
Mordekaiser changes
Veigar changes 

None of these are on there

replies.body:
Kat changes didn't quite do what we'd hoped so they've been pulled for now. Might get revisited at some point, no definitive plans though.

Veigar and Morde changes are tentatively scheduled for 5.4 - they've proved to be tougher jobs than originally hoped.

So you've talked about Veigar, what about Morde? 

His ghost is interesting but for something that's probably the most interesting part of him it feels tacked on and unimportant. I'm guessing it's turning into a damage amp mark, but maybe it should be a summon that consumes a champ if it kills it and interacts like a zed shadow does? 

He just spams spells at you and gets a shield that he doesn't really interact with, but has to spam because the shield goes down like crazy. Maybe it would be cooler if his health costs actually subtracted from his shield first? 

Also giant suit of armor with a mace as a CCless burst Mage squishy is really really weird.

Current direction with Morde involves:

* Making him tankier (let him survive in a fight longer, align with his thematics)
* Shifting him to more of a sustained damage dealer, less of a burst character (better match with a tanky champ, play up the teamplay on both sides from someone being tagged by his ult, rather than just having someone vanish in a cloud of damage and a Ghost appear).
Is there any intention of making him still viable as a AP heavy/mage character with DPS and tankyness sustained by outputting a lot of damage or are you just gonna make him a fighter?
Current intent is that he'll still build AP and be based around his spells, but will live longer/kill slower.
will he get any cc like slows? If he can't burst his enemies, i feel like they can just literally walk away from him if they feel like it.

[Let's use this thread to talk about Mordekaiser](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/8ouZvEL9-lets-use-this-thread-to-talk-about-mordekaiser?show=nested)
The above is a recent discussion about Mordekaiser, there are some ideas on there that might be interesting. There are some concept kits, and I feel it important to mention because of copyright issues floating around, just in case that's a barrier for you when it come to this kind of topic. I appreciate the work you put in, keep it up!

Any chance we can talk about Veigar? He was my first "main" and got me from level 6 to 30, and then a few hundred more.

I stopped playing him mostly because I got tired of losing every single matchup in the game. Once syndra was released I felt like she bursted just as hard as he did, but got to be a bully with hard CC during the early game. I think the last straw was me feeding 4 kills to a vayne who decided she didn't want to deal with Vayne's early game bot lane and went mid to murder me.

I find the design of his kit fascinating in how the Passive + Baleful Strike serve to fuel a sense of megalomania in lane. A sort of, "Just one more stack." That nasus and sion do not share in. That plus who doesn't love that lategame power curve. :D

The thing is, his main appeal is becoming that 1000 AP magic button who can delete any given enemy teammate. Any 2 if the enemy team is mage heavy.

I'm not even sure what sort of buffs he can have. He has 2 brutal point and click damage spells, and an E that is head and shoulders better than most ultimates.

Odds are very high Veigar won't just be straight buffed. His kit's got some serious counterplay issues (undodgeable instant stun when used right, two point and click nukes) that we need to address. Bundled with counterplay improvements though should be some better tools for Veigar himself (e.g. less binary tools, so he's got better options in tough lanes, lower mana costs, lower CDs, bit more range on some stuff etc - note these aren't set in stone changes though, just possibilities). 

With you on the megalomania feel, and we've got no desire to change that.
I get the feeling Veigar is going to join my list of "mains I don't want to play anymore" with Cass, and Skarner soon.

It's arguably a good thing that they've decided to "take more time" with him; it suggests they do care about getting him right. On the other hand, it heightens my concerns that he's going to be completely unrecognizable at the end of this.

*edit, grammar

Tenacity ruins him, so Merc Treads and Banshee's Veil are good mentions, but the rest are completely ridiculous. {{summoner:1}} is a risky summoner spell to pick in general, especially in blind pick. "Champ abilities" is so vague that I don't even know what your point was. Using abilities to dodge spells? Not many people have those, and even fewer that don't require targets like Twisted Advance or Sweeping Blade. {{item:3222}} must be purchased by another play, and even then, isn't suitable for all champs. {{item:3140}}  is completely useless on mages.

When people say he has no counterplay, they mean his extremely powerful, targeted nukes. Event Horizon + Dark Matter is fine where it is. Dark Matter has such a long cast time, that people need to be stunned in order to land it. The problem is that Event Horizon isn't tied to Dark Matter. He can stun people in a huge AoE for 2 1/2 seconds, walk up, erase them with his Q + extremely broken ult.

Seriously, 120% of his own AP AND 80% of an opponent's. This is a joke, and it allows him to get slaughtered in lane but still win fights *because* he lost lane, and his enemy got AP. Consider against {{champion:34}}. Also slow (slower, actually), much more mana hungry, also has very potent AP ratios (two 100%s), and a spell to restrict enemy movement. The difference? You can walk around Crystallize until late game when it becomes huge, even if it blocks your path, it never stuns or even slows you, you can dash through it (whereas Event Horizon stops and stuns people who try that). Her strong AP ratios aren't supplemented by her opponent's, like Veigar's. Event Horizon is max size at level one, and there's no walking around it.

"No counterplay" and "extremely powerful" are not synonyms and Riot and players who think like this need to learn this. Veigar on the enemy team? Guess the support should build a {{item:3222}} or maybe the AP champs need to pick up a {{item:3140}} or a {{item:3102}}.

This isn't aimed at anyone personally, but I'm tired of people QQing because they can only counter a champ at the cost of their beloved full build, braindead, exact same, 6 damage items only. Building defensive items to adjust to your opponent's team comp is the definition of "counterplay." The fact that people think champions can't ever build more than one way is cancerous and needs to be beaten out of them.

Oh and by the way, if you're playing in ranked or normal draft, for one nobody's ever gonna pick Veigar, but on the off chance they do, and he's not last picked, Morgana completely counters him just by existing, and she also happens to be amazing as a support, so she, unlike Veigar, is a versatile and good pick your team won't hate you for.

Secondly I have to address this quote "The problem is that Event Horizon isn't tied to Dark Matter. He can stun people in a huge AoE for 2 1/2 seconds, walk up, erase them with his Q + extremely broken ult."

This is not a problem, this is Veigar's identity. I'm dead serious. **THIS. IS. VEIGAR'S. IDENTITY.** This is literally how and why any and all Veigar players play him. Being able to completely destroy someone cause he stunned them is what he does. Being able to *always* be a threat to the enemy AP champs even if he's way behind or being played as a support is a key component to his appeal. When Riot changes this (which they will) Veigar will be forever alone tier with Urgot, and it will just be more proof that the current balance team doesn't know shit about why people play certain champions. If they reduce or remove his stun, or his ult they'd be better off just taking him behind the shed and putting him out of his misery cause nobody will play him again.

PS. I'm already calling bullshit on the incoming reasons for incoming Veigar nerfs that Riot will inevitably say about Veigar "lacking meaningful tradeoffs." Veigar's meaningful tradeoffs right now are that he's so squishy, immobile, and short range that in order to matter at all he has to meaningfully get in range to land his combo before **HE** gets deleted, it's harder than it sounds, and any smart team will know this and prioritize killing him first, trust me, as someone who plays Veigar, he's not hard to kill. Having to be in a very specific and good position to be able to succeed is a very meaningful tradeoff, in fact it's so meaningful, it's probably the only reason Veigar isn't played constantly and isn't truly OP. Being so hyper-mobile that you don't ever have to worry about positioning like tons of champions in this game are (including most of the newer ones) however is the least meaningful tradeoff of all, and it's insane to me that the balance team doesn't realize this. But oh wait, Veigar's stun wrecks mobile champs so that shit's got to go...

Meddler, please listen to me as I love playing Veigar and from your posts I'm worried he's headed to an awful direction. Veigar doesn't have any counterplay problems, in fact there's a lot of counterplay to him. 

1) Magic Resist. Seems obvious, I know, but you'd be surprised how often people either pick up a miniscule amount or none at all vs Veigar, those people tend to cry the most too. MR really screws with Veigar because of reason #2.

2) He can either kill you with a combo, or he has almost no hope of killing you at all. If you're still alive after Veigar QWR's you, congrats, Veigar is a free kill for you at least until he gets another AP item or farms for days.

3) Stun down? Massive cooldown? Yeah. Veigar's a free kill.

4) BUY TENACITY, BANSHEE'S, OR QSS There isn't a single stat that screws over a champion as much as Tenacity or QSS screws over Veigar. It makes him almost useless.

5) Don't be stupid. If Veigar is on the enemy team and is doing well, don't ignore what I've said above. Everyone who whines about Veigar never buys Tenacity or Banshee's against him.

CHAMPIONS THAT RENDER HIM (largely) USELESS: I don't mean lane counters, I mean champions with skills or abilities that seriously mess with his gameplay.

1) Morgana: Her shield will let enemies pass right through your stun, as well as soak up your damage.
2) Garen: This guy does not die. This is the classic Veigar dilemma of "if you can't combo it, you can't kill it".
3) Anyone with a gapcloser. Veigar is a non-mobile mage, this should be self explanatory.
4) Anyone with temporary invulnerability (including Zhonya's). Nice stun, mind if I walk through it as if it were nothing? Oh was that your ult, sorry it missed me.
5) Anybody who's smart enough to not let Veigar farm in the beginning will render his whole game obsolete.

----

In short, Veigar has more counterplay than a lot of other champions and weakening him further would throw him into trash-tier. He's an immobile mage to boot. 

If these changes do go through, I really hope he gains some extra mobility like Ahri did or lower cooldowns / Mana costs otherwise he's going to drop even further out of the meta.
